intro: Gomphrena cardenasii, commonly known as the Mexican gayfeather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiky flower heads that range in color from pink to red. The plant is typically herbaceous, growing as an annual or biennial, and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Gomphrena cardenasii is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
